userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: The Rockefeller Archive Center has title, copyright, and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them, and has authority to grant permission to cite and publish archival material from the collection.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Material in the Rockefeller family collections that provides the names, correspondence, or activities of living members of the Rockefeller family, and/or documents the net wealth of any Rockefeller family members, is restricted. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by topic, organization, or personal name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This general correspondence file offers extensive documentation on Nelson Rockefeller's business, civic, governmental, philanthropic, cultural, and social activities. Major files cover Dartmouth College's Committee on Economic Development, the Council for Inter-American Cooperation, the Council on Foreign Relations, the Institute for International Social Research, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the Museum of Modern Art (MoMA), the Museum of Primitive Art (MoPA) founded by Rockefeller, the Whitney Museum of American Art,the Pan-American Union (Organization of the American States), Rockefeller Center, the United Jewish Appeal, the United Nations, the U.S. government, the Victory Clothing Drive for Overseas Relief, and the Westchester County Board of Health.

Many of the subject files in this series were periodically weeded of routine correspondence by the clerical staff at the Rockefeller family office. These files are identified with the line: "Some material previous to [date] discarded."

did.unittitle: Ascoli, Dr. Max - General Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Ascoli plan for an Inter-American Institute established by the Coordinator of Inter-American Affairs. Ascoli report on conditions in Chile, Columbia, Peru, Argentina and Brazil in 1943. Was Coordinator of Inter-American Affairs consultant. NAR contribution to Florentine Relief Fund in 1966. Rockefeller Brothers Fund contribution toward Adele Levy Park.

did.unittitle: Atlantic Union - Union Committee

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Efforts to obtain NAR's active support for international union. NAR declined to support this effort. NAR signed "Declaration of Atlantic Unity." Made several small contributions to Union. W. L. Clayton and daughter tried to involve NAR. Organization disbanded in 1970. "Freedom and Union " issues with NAR articles.

did.unittitle: Atomic Energy - General

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

did.unittitle: Museums - Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) - State Department - Exhibit, Secretary Marshall

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence re "The Marshall Affair", which dealt with the withdrawal of the State Department exhibition from Circulation. Discussion of the MoMA position and letter to Secretary G. C. Marshall. Clippings, correspondence re loan of two paintings, 1948. Exhibit in Central America and establishment of Fund to pay for MoMA publications.

did.unittitle: Museums - Museum of Primitive Art, 15 West 54th Street - Charles T. Keppel's Files - General

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Keppel's files as Treasurer of MoPA from his office at 30 Rockefeller Plaza. Miscellaneous memos re salaries, budget, insurance, museum promotion, use of Museum Library, building operational costs. Asmat Soul Shin Exhibition, burglary alarms, publicity. Loans from MoPA. Copy of the Absolute Charter of the Museum of Indigenous Art. Reminders of meetings, workshop in the museum basement. Financial statements as of 12/31/57. Correspondence relating to general running of MoPA, payment of salaries, expenditures, publications, contributions, acknowledgements, personnel, acquisitions and purchases, meetings, committee activities, promotional ideas, exhibits, attendance records.

Sealantic Fund

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Established in 1939 by John Davison Rockefeller, Jr., to provide a means for extending assistance after his death to certain organizations in Westchester County, New York, and on Mount Desert Island, Maine. (Name is derived from a combination of "Seal" Harbor and Poc-"antic"-o.) The Sealantic Fund was merged with the Rockefeller Brothers Fund in 1973. Correspondence re Sealantic donations to Mount Desert Island Hospital, 1963; American Theological Library Association, 1961; American Association of Theological Schools, 1960; Fort Lee Section of Palisades Interstate Park, 1956. Thanks to John Davison Rockefeller, Jr. and Laurance Spelman Rockefeller. List of Sealantic Fund Trustees in 1951. No NAR correspondence.

did.unittitle: Socony-Mobil Oil Company, Inc. (formerly Socony-Vacuum Oil Co.) - General Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Incorporated as The Standard Oil Company of New York in 1882, in 1931 it acquired The Vacuum Oil Company. In 1934 Socony-Vacuum Oil Company ceased to be primarily a holding company and took over the direct operations of certain of its properties. In 1955 it became Socony-Mobil Oil Company, Inc. Remarks of B. Brewster Jennings at the annual meeting of stockholders.

did.unittitle: Department of State: General Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between NAR and Carl McCardle re McCardle's resignation from the Dept. of State, 1957. Summary of Assistant Secretary of State for Inter-American Affairs Henry Holland's speech, "U.S. Economic Relations with South America," 1954. Correspondence re: special activities, meetings, appointments. "Employee Loyalty Investigation." Reports on proposals, policies, and Latin American affairs. Clippings, printed material.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller Center, Inc. - Rainbow Room - Scrapbook

dao.xlink:title: Rockefeller Center, Inc. - Rainbow Room - Scrapbook

daodesc.p: Rockefeller Center, Inc. - Rainbow Room - Scrapbook: 1935-1939

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Magazine articles, newspaper clippings, advertisements, and programs on entertainment at the Rainbow Room, as well as menus, assembled by John Roy, Managing Director of Center Restaurants, Inc. It includes two pieces of NAR correspondence and a few pieces of correspondence from entertainers. Presumably, Mr. Roy reused a binder he already had to assemble this scrapbook, thus the cover refers to the Young Women's League of the Home of the Daughters of Israel, even though none of the content relates to that group.
